questions.question: On the pulse oximetry machine, what would a trend of declining SPO2 represent?
feedback: Incorrect. There is more than one bit of data.
Incorrect. A trend line with a direction provides information. A nurse would use knowledge to interpret the trend.
Observing information is not yet wisdom. No action is required.

questions.question: What practice competency is required for a Level 1 Beginning Nurse to use the pulse oximetry machine?
Which of the following is a decision support system?
choices: An alarm sounds any time the patient’s %SPO2 drops below a 90%.
An alarm sounds when the patient’s 5 minute average for %SPO2 drops below 90%
When the 5 minute average for a patient’s %SPO2 drops below 90%, an alarm sounds with a recommendation appearing on the screen.
When the 5 minute average for a patient’s %SPO2 drops below 90%, the O2 flow to the patient’s cannula is increased to preset intervals.
answers: When the 5 minute average for a patient’s %SPO2 drops below 90%, an alarm sounds with a recommendation appearing on the screen.
questions.feedback: Computer applications designed to facilitate human decision-making processes. Usually decision support systems are rule based, using a specified knowledge base and a set of rules to analyze data and information and provide recommendations to users.

questions.question: A Level 2 Experienced Nurse wishes to determine whether nursing staff are intervening when a patient’s %SPO2 drops below 90%.  The hospital uses NANDA/NIC/NOC. Which taxonomy/ies would the nurse consult?
questions.feedback: Due to the wide variety in nursing diagnoses (e.g., chronic pain; breathing pattern, ineffective), wide variety in interventions, and wide variety in outcomes, the nurses would have to consult all taxonomies to answer this question.

questions.question: Click on the computer monitor and read the note. Does this constitute “meaningful use” in an electronic health record (EHR)?
questions.feedback: Text fields do not allow the data to be used in a meaningful way. Must use codes.
